name: Artificer
description: Masters of invention, artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions.

traits.name: Starting Proficiencies
traits.description: As an Artificer, you are proficient with light/medium armor, shields, and simple weapons. Your saving throw proficiencies are Constitution and Intelligence. You are also proficient with certain tools and two skills of your choice.

choiceOptions.label: Choose one type of artisan's tools

features.name: Magical Tinkering
features.description: You learn how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects, giving them minor magical properties.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You’ve studied the workings of magic and how to cast spells, channeling the magic through objects and tools.

features.name: Infuse Item
features.description: You gain the ability to imbue mundane items with certain magical infusions, turning them into temporary magic items.

features.name: Artificer Specialist
features.description: You choose a specialty for your craft. Your choice grants you features at 3rd, 5th, 9th, and 15th level.

features.name: The Right Tool for the Job
features.description: You can magically create one set of artisan’s tools in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

effects.name: The Right Tool for the Job

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Artificer Specialist feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Artificer Specialist.

features.name: Tool Expertise
features.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

features.name: Flash of Genius
features.description: When you or another creature you can see makes an ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Artificer Specialist feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Artificer Specialist.

features.name: Magic Item Adept
features.description: You can attune to up to four magic items at once and craft common/uncommon magic items faster and cheaper.

features.name: Spell-Storing Item
features.description: You learn how to store a 1st or 2nd-level spell in an object, which can be used by another creature.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Magic Item Savant
features.description: You can attune to up to five magic items at once and ignore all requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

features.name: Artificer Specialist feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Artificer Specialist.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Magic Item Master
features.description: You can attune to up to six magic items at once.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Soul of Artifice
features.description: You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws per magic item you are attuned to. If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can end an infusion to drop to 1 hit point instead.

subclasses.name: Alchemist
subclasses.description: An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away.

features.name: Tool Proficiency
features.description: You gain proficiency with alchemist’s supplies. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

features.name: Experimental Elixir
features.description: Whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce an experimental elixir in an empty flask you touch. Roll for a random effect or choose one by expending a spell slot.

features.name: Alchemical Savant
features.description: Whenever you cast a spell using your alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier to one roll of the spell that restores hit points or deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage.

effects.condition: on one roll of a spell that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage

features.name: Restorative Reagents
features.description: Whenever a creature drinks your experimental elixir, it gains temporary hit points. You can also cast Lesser Restoration a number of times equal to your INT modifier.

effects.condition: when a creature drinks your elixir

features.name: Chemical Mastery
features.description: You gain resistance to acid and poison damage and are immune to the poisoned condition. You can also cast Greater Restoration and Heal without expending a spell slot.

effects.name: Cast Greater Restoration and Heal (once each per long rest)

subclasses.name: Armorer
subclasses.description: An Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin, enhancing their magic, unleashing potent attacks, and generating a formidable defense.

features.name: Tools of the Trade
features.description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor and smith’s tools.

features.name: Arcane Armor
features.description: As an action, you can turn a suit of armor you are wearing into Arcane Armor, which you can use as a spellcasting focus.

features.name: Armor Model
features.description: Choose between Guardian (melee-focused with Thunder Gauntlets and a defensive field) or Infiltrator (stealth-focused with a Lightning Launcher and dampened sound).

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Armor Modifications
features.description: You can apply infusions to individual parts of your Arcane Armor. The maximum number of items you can infuse at once increases by 2.

features.name: Perfected Armor
features.description: Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model, enhancing its Guardian or Infiltrator capabilities.

subclasses.name: Artillerist
subclasses.description: An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield.

features.name: Tool Proficiency
features.description: You gain proficiency with woodcarver’s tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

features.name: Eldritch Cannon
features.description: You can magically create a Small or Tiny eldritch cannon (Flamethrower, Force Ballista, or Protector) which you can activate as a bonus action.

features.name: Arcane Firearm
features.description: You can turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm. When you cast a spell through it, you can add a bonus d8 to one of the spell’s damage rolls.

effects.condition: to one damage roll of an artificer spell cast through the firearm

features.name: Explosive Cannon
features.description: Your eldritch cannon’s damage rolls increase by 1d8. You can also command the cannon to detonate.

features.name: Fortified Position
features.description: You and your allies have half cover while within 10 feet of one of your cannons. You can also have two cannons at the same time.

subclasses.name: Battle Smith
subclasses.description: A Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both material and personnel, often accompanied by a steel defender companion.

features.name: Tool Proficiency
features.description: You gain proficiency with smith’s tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

features.name: Battle Ready
features.description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons. When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

features.name: Steel Defender
features.description: You build a loyal construct companion that aids you in and out of combat.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Arcane Jolt
features.description: When you or your steel defender hits a target, you can channel energy to either deal an extra 2d6 force damage or heal a creature for 2d6 hit points.

features.name: Improved Defender
features.description: Your Arcane Jolt becomes more powerful (4d6) and your steel defender gains a +2 bonus to AC and can deal damage when it uses its Deflect Attack reaction.
